intro: Cryptospora griffithiana, commonly known as the Himalayan cryptospora, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late summer, often in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental change.
